subject: Re: [junit] why are the Assert methods static?
msgSnippet: Perhaps you could write a TestRunner Decorator.  Just wrap whatever TestRunner your are using with your own.  Overide addError and addFailure.to add in your
messageBody:
Perhaps you could write a TestRunner Decorator. Just wrap whatever
TestRunner your are using with your own. Overide addError and
addFailure.to add in your logging?


On Sun, 20 Feb 2005 22:27:01 -0600, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> James Abley wrote:
> > Going back to the original question - how to log it. Could you use
> > AspectJ or similar so that you don't have to bother creating your own
> > version of all the assertXXX methods?
>
> Thank you, James. Yes. I would recommend doing that. I'm no AspectJ
> expert, but I know one, and I have his book. (AspectJ in Action) It's a
> good read and a valuable guide. Definitely worth the investment.
